name: API Whitelist
description: Secures your REDCap API through use of a 'Whitelist' based on IP address, username, and project.  All non-whitelisted requests will be blocked.

crons.cron_description: Cron that runs every 10 minutes to email users' API rejections if valid

system-settings.name:
Description

The API Whitelist inspects all incoming API requests and only permits those that match an API Whitelist Rule. Rules are stored in an API Whitelist Rules Project and can be constructed based on IP address/range, project, and username. The Rules project can also be used as an Exception Request survey for your institution users to request a new Rule.

Examples of whitelist rules are: your VPN network range in CIDR format, a single external server IP address for a collaborator, or a specific project & user that needs to use the REDCap Mobile app from abroad.

If this is your first time enabling this module, use the 'First Time Setup' to create your rules project. Additional information is available from the 'API Whitelist Info' link on the left sidebar of the control center.


This module, once enabled and configured, will apply a filter to all API requests for all projects (including the Mobile App). It DOES NOT filter external module api-urls.

First Time Setup
If this is your first time configuring, check this box and press save
This will automatically create a new API Whitelist Rules Project

API Whitelist Rules Project
This module stores all whitelist rules in a redcap project.

Rejection Help Message
When a request does not match a whitelist rule, the user will receive a HTTP 403 response and the text entered here.
For example, you might give directions to the public survey url of your whitelist rules project.

Notify Rejected Users By Email
When a request is rejected, do you want to additionally notify the API token user's email with the rejection message. This can be useful if they do not programmatically review the text in the 403 authorization invalid response. A maximum of one email per 15 minutes will be sent.

Rejection Email Header
This field will be included in the email for rejected API requests

Rejection Email From Address
(e.g. no-reply@myredcap.com or help@myredcap.com)

API Whitelist Logging Options
You can log all api attempts through one of these options:
  1. No Logging
  2. Database Table: A new table will be added to your schema that records each api call, the user, the project, ip, and duration. This is a great way to identify who is using your API and how much 'cpu-time' they are spending. This is the recommended option.
Note: If you install the emLogger EM, you will automatically get logging to file as configured in your emLogger. You can clear/rotate the log file anytime you like

Activate Whitelist
Once your server is configured and your rules are in-place, you can check this box to activate filtering based on your whitelist

Enable Debug Logging
If you have the Stanford emLogger external module installed and configured, you can enable additional debug-level logging through this checkbox
